Constructor Detail

Cache

public Cache()
Constructs a new empty Cache object. This constructor defaults the maximum number of allowed objects in the cache to 64.

Cache

public Cache(int maxEntries)
Constructs a new empty Cache object with the specified maximum entries allowed in the cache at a time before a replacement strategy is used.
Parameters:
maxEntries - is a integer specifying the maximum allowed objects in the cache.

public boolean containsEntry(java.lang.String reference)
containsEntry determines whether or not a particular Cache.Entry object exists in this cache or not.
Specified by:
containsEntry in interface CacheIF

invalidateCache forces the Cache.Entry objects to be refreshed the next time they are accessed.

isEntryValid

isEntryValid returns whether the specified cache entry is valid or not.

isEntryValid in interface CacheIF
Parameters:
reference:Ljava.lang.String - object (key) referring to the entry in cache.
Returns:

readEntry

public java.lang.Object readEntry(java.lang.String reference)
                           throws IllegalMemoryAccessException
readEntry reads data from the Cache and returns it to the caller. Note, that when a read miss occurs, it is not possible for the entry to be added to cache because the entry did not exist prior to the call and therefore no worker thread exist to retrieve the information.
Specified by:
readEntry in interface CacheIF
Parameters:
reference:Ljava.lang.String - the reference to the Cache.Entry object in memory.
Returns:
Ljava.lang.Object the data stored in Cache that is returned to the caller.
Throws:
Ljjb.toolbox.util.IllegalMemoryAccessException - when the caller of this method tries to access an non-existent entry in the cache.

updateEntry

public void updateEntry(java.lang.String reference,
                        java.lang.Object data)
                 throws IllegalMemoryAccessException
updateEntry updates the content of a particular Cache.Entry object referred to by the reference (key).
Specified by:
updateEntry in interface CacheIF
Parameters:

data:Ljava.lang.Object - the value stored in cache that is associated with the reference.
Throws:

writeEntry

public void writeEntry(java.lang.String reference,
                       java.lang.Object data)
                throws IllegalMemoryAccessException
writeEntry adds a Cache.Entry to this cache object. If the cache is full, then this Cache object (cache manager) uses the least recently used algorithm to decide which object will be dereferenced from this Cache object.
Specified by:
writeEntry in interface CacheIF
Parameters:
reference:Ljava.lang.String - - the object used to reference this entry in cache (memory).
data:Ljava.lang.Object - - the value stored in cache that is associated with the reference.
Throws:
Ljjb.toolbox.util.IllegalMemoryAccessException - - if the Cache.Entry object already exist in this cache. An cache contents cannot be overwritten, only updated and replaced.

writeEntry

public void writeEntry(java.lang.String reference,
                       java.lang.Object data,
                       java.lang.Runnable refreshThread)
                throws IllegalMemoryAccessException
writeEntry adds a Cache.Entry to this cache object. If the cache is full, then this Cache object (cache manager) uses the least recently used algorithm to decide which object will be dereferenced from this Cache object.
Specified by:
writeEntry in interface CacheIF
Parameters:
reference:Ljava.lang.String - the object used to reference this entry in cache (memory).
data:Ljava.lang.Object - the value stored in cache that is associated with the reference.
refreshThread:Ljava.lang.Runnable - the Thread enabled object used to refresh the contents of the Cache.Entry object referenced by the reference.
Throws:
Ljjb.toolbox.util.IllegalMemoryAccessException - - if the Cache.Entry object already exist in this cache. An cache contents cannot be overwritten, only updated and replaced.
